intro: Globba albobracteata, commonly known as the white bract globba, is a herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes ginger and turmeric. The plant features upright, slender stems that bear lance-shaped leaves with a glossy green surface. Its inflorescence consists of small, white flowers surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. Globba albobracteata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has a mild, spicy aroma similar to other members of its family.
